definition: to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: She admits that her life is not a fairy tale and that she faces many challenges.
sentences.chinese: 她坦承她的生活并非童话般轻松，而要面对很多挑战。

sentences.english: The researchers acknowledged the results may be biased since the study was based on a select group and might not apply to locked-in patients in general.
sentences.chinese: 研究者们坦承，研究结果也许是带有些许偏见的。

sentences.english: Were you open with your co-workers and superiors, or did you keep it to yourself?How have your colleagues reacted?
sentences.chinese: 你们是否向同事和上司坦承此事，或是郁结于心？

sentences.english: China was, he confessed, an addiction with him.
sentences.chinese: 他坦承，对中国一往情深。

sentences.english: Finally she confessed to Matsuura that she' d skipped most of the classes.
sentences.chinese: 最后，她向松浦坦承自己逃掉了大半的课程。

sentences.english: Wan zhen willing to pay all for, and admitted to using front xiaoyan against vibration.
sentences.chinese: 婉贞愿意供出一切，又坦承利用小燕对付振锋。

sentences.english: The woman is OK to anybody calm bear her mix flimsily scared, so Where is man?
sentences.chinese: 女人可以向任何人坦承她的脆弱和恐惧，那么男人呢？

sentences.english: He admitted that he had thought about dropping out and taking the test again.
sentences.chinese: 他坦承一开始其实是想休学再重考。

sentences.english: Now the media can acknowledge the impact, but are not to play it up.
sentences.chinese: 现在媒体可以坦承受到冲击，但是并不过分强调。

sentences.english: Rumor had it that Tony declared that he would bring a bottle of liquor to the ceremony to enjoy the show.
sentences.chinese: 据说伟仔坦承会带瓶酒出席颁奖礼，边看边喝。

definition: to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
to express/to show/to say/to state/to indicate/to mean
to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
to refer to/to speak about/to talk about
to declare to be untrue/to deny
to give an interview/to be interviewed/to respond to (questions, a survey etc)
